title: Graphium adamastor
text:
Graphium adamastor, the Boisduval's white lady, is a <a href="butterfly">butterfly</a> in the family <a href="Papilionidae">Papilionidae</a> (swallowtails). It is found in <a href="Guinea">Guinea</a>, <a href="Sierra%20Leone">Sierra Leone</a>, <a href="Mali">Mali</a>, <a href="Burkina%20Faso">Burkina Faso</a>, <a href="Ivory%20Coast">Ivory Coast</a>, <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>, <a href="Togo">Togo</a>, <a href="Benin">Benin</a>, <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>, <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>, the <a href="Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Republic of the Congo</a>, the <a href="Central%20African%20Republic">Central African Republic</a> and the <a href="Democratic%20Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Democratic Republic of the Congo</a>.
Description.
"G.adamastor" is very similar to the preceding species "<a href="Graphium%20agamedes">Graphium agamedes</a>" and only differs in that the transverse spot of the cell of the forewing is larger and reaches the front margin of the cell, the discal spot in cellule 2 on the contrary is smaller and rounded or entirely wanting, so that the median hand is here interrupted. — Ashanti and Togo. 
Biology.
Its habitat consists of <a href="Tropical%20and%20subtropical%20dry%20broadleaf%20forests">dry forests</a> and the transition zone between forests and the <a href="Guinean%20forest-savanna%20mosaic">Guinea savanna</a>.
Adult females <a href="Mimicry">mimic</a> "<a href="Amauris%20damocles">Amauris damocles</a>". Both sexes feed from flowers, including "<a href="Calodendrum%20splendens">Calodendrum splendens</a>".
The larvae feed on various <a href="Annonaceae">Annonaceae</a> species.
Taxonomy.
"Graphium adamastor" belongs to a <a href="Species%20complex">species group</a> with 16 members. All are very similar
The species group members are:
